notesStmt.note: Stained. Imperfect at the beginning (folio 1 largely mutilated). Many pages water-stained.

An owner's note in Arabic characters, partly erased: folio 225v.Folios 1, 2, 226, 227 contain parts of the Commentary on the Pentateuch by Bahya ben Asher, covering verses from Numbers 11, Deuteronomy 23, 22 and 28.
Manuscript description based on Margoliouth, G.: Catalogue of the Hebrew and Samaritan Manuscripts in the British Museum, London 1965.

msItem.title: Perush Seder zera῾im פרוש סדר זרעים

collation.p: Quires of mostly 10 leaves each, numbered with Hebrew letters and marked by catchwords at the end. The volume is made up of fragments, of which folios 39-212 form the largest, of 16 quires.

scriptDesc.scriptNote: Yemenite square and semi-cursive script of the 15th nad 16th century.
